intro: Allophylus roigii, commonly known as the red-fruit alder, is a species of flowering plant in the family Saracinoideae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the early spring. Its fruits are drupes, typically red or orange in color, which are an important food source for various bird species. Allophylus roigii is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories and along stream banks.
